greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows giving successive states of cellular automaton generated by "Rule 28" and by "Rule 156".
comment: Eigensequence of the triangle = A038754. (i.e. 1, 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 18,...) shifts
to the left with multiplication by triangle A070909.
Binomial transform of A070909 = triangle A177953. (End)
Generalized (conditional) Riordan array with k-th column generated by If(mod(k,2)=0,x^k/(1-x),x^k).
A181651 is an eigentriangle. Inverse is A181650. (End)
reference: S. Wolfram, A New Kind of Science, Wolfram Media, 2002; Chapter 3.
link: Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
mathematica: rows = 14; ca = CellularAutomaton[28, {{1}, 0}, rows-1]; Flatten[Table[ca[[k, 1 ;; k]], {k, 1, rows}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 24 2012 *)
xref: Cf. A038754, A070909 [From _Gary W. Adamson_, May 15 2010]
results.author: _Hans Havermann_, May 26 2002
